result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L. Hart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert L. Hart was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Hart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from 16CM821;  jk/mg

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentenced to serve 90 days in Co. Jail, credit for 79 days served.  (Court considers this time served.)  Pay costs.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.  Cash bond to apply to costs in this file and in 16CF778 and any balance returned to poster.  Cash bond in 16CM821 to apply in this file if necessary.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Cassie Baumgardner.  Clerk: PT
DE has new pending charges so parties mutually request an adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court met with both the DA and Defense Counsel and approves request to set over for a Status on Monday instead of a trial.
Email Correspondence from Atty Baumgardner
Scheduling Order

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Robert L. Hart, appeared with Attorney Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved and scheduling order is given to parties.  Parties are instructed to submit a letter or email to the court by 7/21 at 1:00 PM in place of a jury status hearing.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 6, 2016 at 10:50 am. confirmed with Atty Baumgardner
Due to a continued jury trial; FPT rescheduled to 5/6/16 at 10:50 AM pending confirmation from Atty Baumgardner.
Hearing rescheduled to 4/12/16 at 8:50 AM pending confirmation from Atty Baumgardner
Court has reviewed and approves request for adjournment with no objection by the State.
Email correspondence received from Atty Baumgardner requesting to adjourn hearing tomorrow due to death in family.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Baumgardner requests time to review evidence with defendant.  FPT 3/3/16 at 8:40.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motion to modify the no contact condition of bond is argued.  The court denies the motion for the reasons stated by Atty Trigg and for failure of the victim to appear in court today.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
for a Bond Modification filed by Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  (Hearing 1/15/16 at 9:45.)
$500 deposited on 12/31/15
Final pre-trial at 02-09-2016 09:30 a.m.  Date changed from 2/2/16 at 8:30 on the Court's own motion.
Email Correspondence from ADA Drees
Atty Cassi Baumgarner

*No Contact w/ Vickie H or her residence.

Not Guilty plea entered.  Deft demands jury trial Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
